column2: [arˈkastar]}}) is the [[Quenya]] rendition of the surname [[J.R.R. Tolkien

column1: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] signed as ''Arcastar [[Mondósar]]esse'' "Tolkien in Oxford" in a [[1968]] letter to the producer of the [[BBC]] documentary ''[[Tolkien in Oxford]]''.<ref>{{webcite

The exact meaning of ''Arcastar'' is unknown. [[Ryszard Derdzinski]] has suggested that ''arcastar'' could possibly mean "translator" (or "one who carries across"), based on his research about the [[Tolkien Family
